item.title: Thirteen Thirteens
item.description: Thirteen thirteens draws it‚Äôs name from an organization of teams that are competing and cooperating to divvy up control of spaces and access to resources ...

item.title: Ladon
item.description: In Norse mythology, Ladon is the dragon who guards the golden apples of immortality, which keep the gods youthful. In the systems of software that is Yggdrasil, Nike keeps track of goods as they move through the courier system & Ladon aids people who run holding locations to.

item.title: Serial Mobbing
item.description: A Serial Mob is akin to a pair programming session. In pair programming there‚Äôs a Navigator who describes the program to write and the Driver who operates the UI and does the physical writing.

item.title: Pandora
item.description: In some of the Yggdrasil Outposts, there are a wall of lockers with two doors in each. One side faces a ‚Äúlocker room‚Äù where someone with a key code (or wallet signature) is able to unlock a locker and retrieve its contents.

item.title: Helios
item.description: ‚ÄúHalf‚Äù of the transport system managed by Leviathan is a network of drivers moving parcels between holding stations. Holding stations may be lockers or human-managed locations.

item.title: Leviathan
item.description: The goal is to abolish traditional physical goods markets in favor of a ‚Äúfractured market‚Äù where the goods are held jointly by storage locations and transport media ...
